decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to utilize Zurgo Bellstriker as a powerful aggro commander in a Duel Commander 1 vs 1 format. The deck is packed with a wide variety of low-cost and efficient burn spells, creatures, and mana sources to consistently apply pressure and deal damage to the opponent quickly. With cards like Lightning Bolt, Goblin Guide, and Sulfuric Vortex, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with direct damage and fast creatures. The inclusion of cards like Magus of the Moon and Bloodstained Mire also helps disrupt opponent's mana bases and further push the aggressive strategy of the deck. Overall, the goal is to be fast, efficient, and relentless in dealing damage to secure victories.

The main focus of this deck is to play aggressively with a combination of creatures and spells that can quickly deal damage to the opponent. The commander, Deadpool, adds to this strategy by providing additional value and flexibility in card selection. The deck includes a variety of removal spells, hand disruption, and efficient creatures to maintain pressure on the opponent. It also utilizes a mix of lands and mana acceleration to ensure consistent and fast plays. With a combination of efficient spells, creatures, and synergies with the commander, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and maintain a strong board presence throughout the game.

The deck revolves around utilizing aggressive creatures and powerful removal spells to control the board and deal damage quickly to the opponent. With Deadpool, Trading Card as the commander, the deck focuses on a fast-paced strategy that combines efficient creatures like Troll of Khazad-d√ªm and Seasoned Pyromancer with disruptive spells such as Thoughtseize and Terminate. Additionally, the deck includes a variety of lands that help fix mana and provide additional utility, such as Shizo, Death's Storehouse and Tectonic Edge. By efficiently removing threats and applying pressure with its creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through aggressive tactics and resource management.

This deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy with a mix of disruption and removal spells to control the game and apply pressure on the opponent. The commander, Kefka, Court Mage, provides a strong central figure for the deck, allowing for recursion and card advantage. The deck includes a variety of low-cost efficient creatures and spells to maintain tempo and keep the opponent on the defensive. With a strong mana base and access to powerful spells like Demonic Tutor and Force of Will, the deck aims to outmaneuver the opponent and secure victory through a combination of efficient threats and disruptive spells.

The main strategy of this deck revolves around utilizing powerful black mana generation cards like Cabal Coffers and Cabal Stronghold to fuel efficient removal spells and disruption. The Commander, Acererak the Archlich, serves as both a win condition and a source of card advantage. By combining disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek with powerful tutors like Demonic Tutor and Grim Tutor, the deck aims to control the game until it can assemble a game-winning combo. With a focus on resource denial and efficient removal, this deck is designed to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a 1 vs 1 Duel Commander format, ultimately leading to a decisive victory through powerful synergies and card advantage.

This Azusa, Lost But Seeking deck focuses on ramping quickly and efficiently to get ahead of opponents and control the board. Utilizing cards like Exploration, Burgeoning, and Oracle of Mul Daya to put extra lands into play and stay ahead on mana, the deck aims to get to its powerful threats like Primeval Titan, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Emrakul, the Promised End quickly. With strong land-based synergy cards like Ramunap Excavator, Crucible of Worlds, and Life from the Loam, the deck can continually recur lands and maintain a strong board presence. The deck also includes versatile spells like All Is Dust, Conduit of Worlds, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to control the battlefield and outvalue opponents.

The main concept of this deck is to build a strong aggro strategy centered around Cloud, Midgar Mercenary as the commander. The deck includes a variety of low-cost creatures and equipment to quickly establish a strong board presence and apply pressure to the opponent. Cards like Giver of Runes, Mother of Runes, and Ranger-Captain of Eos provide protection for key creatures, while equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine and Umezawa's Jitte enhance their abilities and make them even more threatening. The deck also includes disruption elements like Drannith Magistrate and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to control the opponent's resources and slow down their game plan. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient combat tricks.

The deck revolves around controlling the game by countering spells, removing threats, and disrupting the opponent's strategy. It utilizes a variety of counterspells like Counterspell, Cryptic Command, and Force Spike, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Damnation. The deck also includes cards that allow for card advantage and selection such as Brainstorm, Demonic Tutor, and Intuition. Additionally, it has utility lands like Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth and Mystic Sanctuary to further disrupt the opponent. The commander, Hidetsugu and Kairi, provide additional control elements and can synergize with the rest of the deck to maintain board control and outmaneuver the opponent.
